docstr: `COMPLEX` — Complex conversion function ### Description `COMPLEX(X, Y)` returns a complex number where `X` is converted to the real component and `Y` is converted to the imaginary component. ### Syntax `RESULT = COMPLEX(X, Y)` ### Arguments . | `Y` | The type may be `INTEGER` or `REAL`. ### Return value If `X` and `Y` are both of `INTEGER` type, then the return value is of default `COMPLEX` type. If `X` and `Y` are of `REAL` type, or one is of `REAL`type and one is of `INTEGER` type, then the return value is of `COMPLEX` type with a kind equal to that of the `REAL`argument with the highest precision. ### Example ``` program test_complex     integer :: i = 42     real :: x = 3.14     print *, complex(i, x) end program test_complex ``` ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Elemental function ### See also CMPLX
